article.title: Galactic Rings Revisited. II. Dark Gaps and the Locations of Resonances in Early-to-Intermediate Type Disk Galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows schematics of the outer resonant ring/pseudoring morphologies in barred galaxies. What is the defining characteristic of R′₂ pseudorings?
choices: An ≈180° winding of the main spiral arms from near one end of the bar to the other.
A doubling of the spiral arms in two opposing quadrants.
A figure-eight pattern with "dimples" that pinch in towards the bar axis.
A combination of R′₁ and R′₂ features.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2 displays a frame from a numerical simulation of a strongly-barred disk galaxy. What phenomenon is being illustrated in this frame?
choices: The formation of a bar within a galactic disk.
The depopulation of the region around the L4 and L5 Lagrangian points.
The interaction of a bar with a spiral arm.
The development of star formation within an inner ring.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows a deprojected g-band image and a g−i color index map of UGC 4596. What does the g−i color index map reveal about the dark gaps between the rings?
choices: The gaps are bluer than the surrounding disk.
The gaps are redder than the surrounding disk.
The gaps have the same color as the surrounding disk.
The gaps show strong evidence of dust lanes.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 6 shows the results of a Fourier intensity analysis of UGC 4596. Despite the lack of an apparent bar, what does the maximum m=2 relative amplitude (A₂) suggest?
choices: The presence of a weak oval distortion.
The influence of spiral arms on the light distribution.
The presence of a strong bar-like perturbation.
The presence of a double-humped surface brightness profile.

multiple_choice_question.text: Athanassoula et al. (1982) provide formulae for predicting the locations of major ring-forming resonances in galaxies with flat rotation curves.  Assuming rCR is the radius of corotation, what formula correctly predicts the radius of the outer Lindblad resonance (rOLR)?
choices: rOLR = 0.58rCR
rOLR = 1.26rCR
rOLR = 1.71rCR
rOLR = 2.64rCR
